comments.text: Perfect spot to go to karakol from, me and another traveler went to the dead lake.  But it is a really good spot!

Good spot going towards Karakol by the south side. Be aware that some drivers will expect small payment from you (especially minivan drivers) since it's common here to share a rides. However many will lift you for free.
Was easy to find a free ride to Osh. A lot of taxis too though so make sure it's free as always here.
Easy rides to Sary-Tash as long as there's cars.

From the gas station here you will have  an easy time getting to the Kazach border.  Some people might stop 6 km before the border crossing, but overall you should be able to make it within an hour from here.

Just get further from this spot as soon as possible, because there are many taxis driving here, drive to the next village taldy suu and from there it is a piece of cake hitchhiking!  Goodluck to Kazachstan!

Listen to the advice from other hitchhikers taking the eastern road from karakol, this road to Kazachstan is a lot easier to hitchhike!  Take this route if you want to make it to Kazachstan as quickly as possible!
People are more likely to ask for money here, but keep standing, more drivers will pull up! Don’t let the pessimism of other taxi drivers pull you down!
Same as before, traffic is really high and people will stop for you )))
Cars have enough space to stop. And traffic is really high.  Make sure you tell them you are a hitchhiker, they will most likely take you )))
Got tea and free accommodation, 10/10 spot.  Car traffic is very high and there is enough space for cars to stop.
Kyrgyz trucks almost always stop for you, even though there is not too much space.  Really good spot to go to Bishkek.
Got a car to Кызарт, in no time pretty good spot if you wanna go Osh
catch a lory to the biskek
good lifts to the near canyon close to the main road, a lot of people go in direction of Biskek
nice place where is a lot of yurts, but everyone is going just to the nearest village
We were three people and a bicycle. A truck picked us up really fast. There is a place where all the trucks from and to the chinese border are waiting.
Driver and wife were very nice. Demanded more money than I offered
Good spot to hitchhike to Ala archa mountains. If you're short on time just take a bus towards Baytik (30 som, around 0.3 euro). From there is really easy.

There is a roofed bus stop giving you shadow. Low traffic in the morning but every second car stop for you. I was asked for money at the end of the ride. I paid 500 som, because it was a 7 hour ride on a bumpy unpaved road across the mountains.

There is no road shown on OpenStreetMap but there is an intersection where 2 main roads merge together. Got a ride to Kazarman (don't be fooled by Google Maps, there is actually a road) and it was a very scenic route of untouched nature. Also, they didn't demand any money
There are Chinese truckers going to the truck stop near Osh. Very easy to get a free or paid hitchhike here.
Trucks and locals passing by. I found a ride until At-Bashi by a old man. If you want to go further probably better stopping trucks.

Immediate ride North with a truck driver all the way to Osh! Spectacular road, as with the rest of centra asia the truck are disturbingly slow. Mentioned baz platna (without payment) when I got in, all good, some local hitchikers where also picked up and did not pay. Got invited to a meal with the locals midride!

Hitched a truck down to the turn-off for Tash Rabat (15km walk from here but if you're lucky you can get a lift with other visitors). Most of the traffic after At Bashy is trucks heading to the Torugart pass. I asked a car transporter that had stopped just before leaving the town, if you end up sticking your thumb out I'd recommend turning right at the end of this road and try at the petrol station, vehicles are often going too fast to stop after this.
Very good spot. Its kind of a rest area. Could also ask people directly there. We waited at the street and got away smoothly.
Got a ride from a truck until the cross for Tash Rabat.
Great spot for Naryn direction. The road is better now. I stood after the bridge so there's a bit more room to stop.

Here is another option to go to Naryn. Road is new and more preferrable by most friendly cars from Bishkek.
There is some difficulties to stop due to concrete walls on the side of the road but cars will stop after some time anyway.
Not many cars. Backpackers were accumulating at this spot. Soon will be more traffic and more easy when new road is open. We took a taxi from Kazarman to get to this spot.

Not many people passing by, but we were picked up directly upon arrival by a truck. The road to the pass is very bumpy, 5 hours to reach Jalalabad. The wait can be long, but the few people who stop will surely stop. No need to pay for us.
Fast speeds but plenty of visibility and room to stop. There's a gas station across the road too. Probably able to find one straight to Osh if lucky but I about half way with my ride.
More chill and less local rides or taxis than in Osh.
easy to hitch, but make sure the driver doesn't want payment before you get in (do this across KG in general but especially here)
Dropped us off right at the hostel.  Was late in the evening but still picked us up.  Whole south route of issik kül is a good hitchhiking road!
Just walk along the main road along son kël, there will be people driving there every now and then. Cheers

the people here activly ask us if we want the ride, they are used to tourist and demand a fee for the hitch. we agree that they will take us ont the horrible road on south side of isik-kul on a before specified place.
the "taxi" start to appear here, even through there is a bus stop no bus is going here, just a shop and some houses. we get the ride to the nearest village čajek
there is almost zero traffic - if there is some it just goes 2 km to the nearest houses. we walked 20% of the way by foot before we catch a car. (it was the 6. car going around us)
Don't take this eastern route to Kazakhstan, go north through Tyup instead. Getting the first ride here isn't an issue but later on it gets veeeery quiet.
High speeds but gets the job done. A lot of rides to Bishkek. Didn't quite make it there with this ride as their engine broke climbing up the mountain :D
Anywhere on this road works really.
Ride to Talas very quickly.
Quiet but eventually you will be picked up this being Central Asia after all. Works both ways.
There was one truck already full so they asked another one. Paid like 500 som
good place to catch a lorys, through day it was fast, it is cold and high. may 2024
We stood almost 1 hour after sunset and almost got frostbites in 3rd decade of september 2011.
Weird place to h-hike to Talas. Altitude is around 3000 meters. It's very cold and windy after sunset. Do not freeze waiting for the lift.
